content:
BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.biography.com/scientist/albert-einstein
ENDCONTEXT
Albert Einstein, a prominent figure in physics, showed prodigious talent from an early age. He started speaking at just one year old and reading complex texts by the age of three. Although he made significant contributions to science, he never received the Nobel Prize in Physics.

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
At what ages did Albert Einstein start speaking and reading, and did he win a Nobel Prize?
Citation?
ENDINSTRUCTION

BEGININPUT
Albert Einstein began speaking at the age of one year and was reading complex texts by the age of three. However, contrary to the statement provided, Einstein did receive the Nobel Prize in Physics, specifically in 1921, for his services to theoretical physics, particularly for his discovery of the law of the photoelectric effect.

Citation:

"Albert Einstein." Biography.com, A&E Networks Television, https://www.biography.com/scientist/albert-einstein.

ENDINPUT
